definition: billows/great waves (fig. of a story with great momentum)
Poland/Polish/abbr. for 波蘭|波兰[Bo1 lan2]
surging forward with great momentum/unfolding on a magnificent scale
one climax follows another (of thrilling story)

sentences.english: Across the highway, water wells concubines heart.
sentences.chinese: 波瀾誓不起，妾心井中水。

sentences.english: Ah, the society is a large stage, so is human life a living play with one climax following another.
sentences.chinese: 呵，社會是一個大舞臺，人生是一出波瀾起伏的活劇。

sentences.english: And Sheldon is action more cream soup out of light waves.
sentences.chinese: 而曉東的行動更激湯出萬丈波瀾。

sentences.english: On the way of life, always meet ups and downs.
sentences.chinese: 在人生的道路上，總會遇到波瀾起伏的事情。

sentences.english: His term as president was tumultuous.
sentences.chinese: 他在職總統期間可謂波瀾起伏。

sentences.english: Waves spread a layer, the wrist on the ground looked on his forehead as burnout.
sentences.chinese: 波瀾一層層蔓延開來，腕就那樣倦怠地枕着額頭。

sentences.english: I can do it, when you face the placid.
sentences.chinese: 我終於可以做到，面對你時波瀾不驚。

sentences.english: Who gave me love placid who accompany me to see through the fleeting landscape.
sentences.chinese: 㦨翩誰給我波瀾不驚的愛情，誰陪我看透流年的風景。

sentences.english: In the edge of the vast South China Sea, a red sun is rising.
sentences.chinese: 在波瀾壯闊的中國南海之端，一輪紅日正在冉冉升起。

sentences.english: Externally, Flannery O’Connor’s life was, except in the matter of her physical travails, uneventful.
sentences.chinese: 其實，弗蘭納裏，除了病中劫難，她的生活波瀾不驚。

sentences.english: Surface is always static, but it is where the formation of typhoons.
sentences.chinese: 面總是波瀾不興，但它卻是形成颱風的地方。

sentences.english: What means this tumult in a vestal's veins?
sentences.chinese: 這樣的波瀾在修女的心中意味着什麼？

sentences.english: Your mind is like this water, when it agitated, it becomes difficulit to see.
sentences.chinese: 你的心好似這潭湖水，如果波瀾起伏，就會模糊不清。

sentences.english: To soar above the undulating palm fronds?
sentences.chinese: 翱翔在波瀾起伏的棕櫚樹葉？

sentences.english: On the stormy sea, He speaks peace to me.
sentences.chinese: 水正起波瀾，祂在說平安。

definition: to wash/to squander/to sweep away/to move/to shake/dissolute/pond
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
to recount/to narrate/to give an account of
bosom/heart/mind/to think of/to harbor in one's mind/to conceive (a child)
